review: I hooked this up with my MacBook Pro. If you're just going to stream videos from YouTube and have a Netflix account, this is for you - as long as you don't mind lagging videos. Quick solution? Adjust the settings so you can see the videos with LESS lag in 480p (that looks soooo good on HD TVs - sarcasm intended). I don't have a Netflix account - I have an Amazon Prime account (and with it Prime video) so no need for Netflix. (Speaking of Amazon Prime Instant Video, let's get with the HD streaming on Mac, Amazon!) so the only thing I can really use this for is YouTube videos.I have an Apple TV on a separate TV and that streams flawlessly and there are no limitation; if I can see it on my computer, I can see it on the TV - anything and everything (pics, videos, music, Office, anything).Pros:Cool pictures on the screensaver!Relatively inexpensiveCons:Limited uses (YouTube and apparently NetFlix work)Lagging videosIt's waste of money.
author: R. Jones

review: Never connected with my wifi. Extremely disappointed with product. I'm not that goofy that I don't know how to set up a home network or pc. The directions were clear and straightforward. I downloaded the app and follow the instructions. Every time I get it to connect to the wifi as soon as it tried to authenticate,  it disconnected from the wifi and say I was not connected.  After about 5 attempts,  I just quit. Plug and play it is not. I factory reset, plugged it into the wall, into the TV... Nothing. The TV detected the device - never found wifi signal even with the unit sitting directly next to it.I'll wait for the 18 months Google decides to update the unit.  In the meantime I'll just buy a cable and hook my phone up the old fashioned way.
